intro: Parasenecio pentalobus, commonly known as the five-lobed cudweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, with a distinctive five-lobed shape, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Parasenecio pentalobus is often found in open habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
